VI.ii.3.A.2.a
.
Number of Days Reservists and Members of the National Guard Commonly Receive Drill Pay
During a single fiscal year, reservists and members of the National Guard commonly receive drill pay for a total of 63 days, which consists of
48 armory drills or training sessions, and
15 days of active duty training.
Note
:Â  Variances in the 63-day total are typically due to
excused absences from drills, or
the performance of additional drills or training for various assignments, such as
schooling
planning meetings
conferences
preparation for inspections
additional flying training
muster duty, or
funeral honors duty.
title: M21-1, Part VI, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section A - Adjusting Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Benefits Based on a Veteran's Receipt of Drill Pay
